content: PDF form <1>{{filename}}</1> is ready to be filled out.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a success message when a PDF form is ready to be filled out. The message includes the title of the form file. It appears in a toast notification in the GlobalEvents component's button context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets '<1>{{filename}}</1>' appear to be incorrectly formatted and might interfere with rendering or processing.  They seem to be intended for placeholder identification but aren't standard.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets and just have {{filename}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "جاهز للتعبئة" (jaahiz lil-ta'bi'ah) translates to 'ready to be filled out', a more natural and common phrasing in Arabic (Saudi Arabia) for a PDF form would be "جاهز للتعبئة" (jaahiz lil-ta'bi'ah). The slight change improves readability and naturalness.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "جاهز للتعبئة" to "جاهز للتعبئة".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The verb conjugation 'doldurulmağa' is archaic and sounds unnatural. A more common and modern form would be 'doldurulmaqdadır'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{filename}}</1> PDF forması doldurulmaqdadır.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The XML-like tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Bulgarian versions. These are likely placeholders intended to be removed during implementation and shouldn't be part of the translated text itself.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags <1> and </1> from the Bulgarian translation. The correct translation should be: 'PDF формуляр {{filename}} е готов за попълване.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in the Greek translation, mirroring the English. This might not be necessary or stylistically correct in Greek UI text. Consider removing them or adjusting to a more natural Greek formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets. The translated text should be 'Η φόρμα PDF {{filename}} είναι έτοιμη να συμπληρωθεί.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in the Armenian translation, mirroring the English. While technically correct, it's unusual to maintain the formatting tags in the translated text. These tags are likely for internal processing and should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets <1> and </1> from the Armenian translation.  The translation should simply be: "PDF ձև {{filename}} պատրաստ է լրացման։"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in the Korean translation, mirroring the English. While technically not incorrect, they are unnecessary and visually disrupt the Korean text. These tags are likely intended for placeholders in a UI framework and should be removed for a natural-sounding translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: PDF 양식을 작성할 준비가 되었습니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'to be filled out' is not the most natural translation in Lao. A more common phrasing would be 'ສາມາດຕື່ມຂໍ້ມູນໄດ້' (can fill out data) or 'ໃຊ້ຕື່ມຂໍ້ມູນໄດ້' (can use to fill data).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ແບບຟອມ PDF <1>{{filename}}</1> ພ້ອມແລ້ວທີ່ຈະສາມາດຕື່ມຂໍ້ມູນໄດ້.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag `<1>` and `</1>` are unnecessary and should be removed, as they don't seem to serve a purpose in the Latvian translation context. They appear to be remnants of the English template.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags `<1>` and `</1>` from the Latvian translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Formularz' directly translates to 'Form' which can sound too informal or abrupt in Polish. 'PDF Formularz' would be more natural and professional.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: PDF Formularz

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'jest gotowy do wypełnienia' is grammatically correct, a more idiomatic and natural phrasing in Polish would be 'można go wypełnić' (can be filled out).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: jest gotowy do wypełniania

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in the Sinhala translation, mirroring the English. This might not be necessary or appropriate for Sinhala formatting and could be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets: "PDF ආකෘතිය {{filename}} දැන් පිරවීම සඳහා සූදානම්ය."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in the Slovenian translation, mirroring the English. While this isn't inherently incorrect, it's unusual in UI text and might be better to remove or handle in the UI rendering to insert the filename. Consider if this is a required formatting element.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the angle brackets or adjusting the UI to handle the variable insertion.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "формулар" is a transliteration of 'form' and not a standard Serbian word for form. A more appropriate translation would be 'образац'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: PDF образац <1>{{filename}}</1> је спреман да буде попуњен.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The opening and closing tags `<1>` and `</1>` appear to be unnecessary and potentially incorrect in this context. They might be remnants from a specific formatting system and don't translate naturally into Serbian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags entirely. The sentence can be translated as 'PDF образац {{filename}} је спреман да буде попуњен.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'formular' is not the correct Serbian translation for 'form'. The correct term is 'obrazac'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: PDF obrazac <1>{{filename}}</1> je spreman da bude popunjen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The spacing around the `<1>` and `</1>` tags is inconsistent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: PDF obrazac <1>{{filename}}</1> je spreman da bude popunjen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tags <1> and </1> appear to be intended for formatting or placeholders but are unnecessary in Turkish. They are just copying the English format without considering Turkish conventions. While technically valid, they'll cause issues with rendering and potentially confusion.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags. The translation should be "PDF formu {{filename}} doldurulmaya hazır."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in the Ukrainian translation and should be consistent with the English. While they indicate placeholders, they are redundant and might cause issues with the rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "để được điền" is a bit awkward and not the most natural way to say "to be filled out" in Vietnamese. It implies someone is *allowed* to fill it out, rather than simply stating it's ready for filling.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Biểu mẫu PDF <1>{{filename}} </1> đã sẵn sàng để điền.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets (<1> and </1>) are present in the Chinese translation, mirroring the English content. While technically correct as they're likely placeholders, it's unusual and potentially confusing for Chinese users to see these. They should likely be removed or handled differently within the UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets.  The UI should handle the `{{filename}}` placeholder correctly.
